sections.title: Statement Cycle
rules: Your statement generates every month on a fixed date.
Transactions after statement date go to next cycle.
examples: If your bill date is 3rd, a purchase on 4th goes to next month.
notes: Statement PDF includes total due, minimum due, due date, and rewards summary.

sections.title: Total Due vs Minimum Due
rules: Total due must be paid to avoid interest.
Minimum due prevents late fee but interest STILL applies on remaining balance.
examples: If total = 15,000 and minimum due = 1,500, paying 1,500 avoids late fee but interest applies on 13,500.
notes: Paying only minimum due repeatedly leads to large interest accumulation.

sections.title: Payment Posting
rules: UPI / netbanking payments typically post instantly.
IMPS/NEFT may take up to 3 hours.
Refunds appear when the merchant settles the transaction.
examples: If Amazon refunds ₹999, it may take 5–7 days depending on merchant settlement.
notes: Refunds reduce total outstanding immediately once posted.
